markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Niyaháat](/Armor.aspx?ID=31)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Laminar" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=482" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 11 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 gp

**AC Bonus** +3

**Dex Cap** +2

**Check Penalty** -2

**Speed Penalty** -5 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 14

**Bulk** 2

**Category** Medium

**Group** Skeletal
</row>

</column>

---

Erutaki communities deep in the Crown of the World, where wood is hard to come by, fashion armor from slats and strips of bone or horn, along with whole bones or horns. Wealthier wearers sometimes pay for decorative embellishments made of more precious materials. Niyaháat is usually woven together with strong cord, forming a suit like a breastplate. This suit is worn over heavy clothing or a surcoat like [padded armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3). Some suits incorporate parts of powerful creatures, creating a storied history for the suit and its wearers.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-6" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Remorhaz Armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1852)
name: Niyaháat
